DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: BORGES, L. E.;Borges, L.;Borges, Lavinia E.;Borges, Lavinia E;Borges, L.E.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Graduada em Medicina (1999) pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (UFMG). Residкncia mйdica em Ginecologia/Obstetricia (2001) e em Reproduзao Humana (2002) pela UFMG. Atuou como pesquisadora clinica pelo Laboratorio de Reproduзao Humana do Hospital das Clinicas (HC) da UFMG de 2002 a 2005. Em 2009 concluiu com кxito o doutoramento em Biotecnologia Mйdica, com area de atuaзao em Ginecologia-Obstetricia, pela Universitа di Siena, Itаlia. Atualmente й mйdica ginecologista do HC-UFMG e desenvolve projetos de pesquisa nas areas de ginecologia e obstetricia, com кnfase em endometriose, regulaзao da funзao endometrial e do processo de implantaзao.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Medicina from Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (1999). Has experience in Medicine, focusing on Child Health, acting on the following subjects: cycle control, doenзa de castleman, contraceptive efficacy, inhibin and estroprogestinici.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: The Role of Urocortin in endometrial angiogenesis in vitro mediate by CRH receptors in endometriosis
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Como a Ucn apresenta propriedades terapêuticas moduladoras da neovascularização e proliferação celular, eventos fundamentais ao desenvolvimento da endometriose, o objetivo do presente estudo è avaliar as relações parácrinas responsáveis pela neoangiogênese, crescimento e invasividade celular, através da ativação dos receptores 1 e 2 do CRH, utilizando como modelo a cultura de células endometriais estromais humanas (HESC) de pacientes sadias e pacientes com endometriose.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dipartimento di Pediatria, Ostetricia e Medicina della Riproduzione

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Evaluation of umbilical vein endothelial cells as putative sources of activin A and follistatin in pregnancies complicated by pre-eclampsia
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Background: Cord serum activin A is increased in pregnancies complicated by pre-eclampsia and fetal hypoxia. Objective: To investigate whether human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVEC) express activin A and follistatin and to localize both proteins and mRNA in pregnancies affected by pre-eclampsia with and without alteration of fetal Doppler parameters. Then, to investigate the effect of pro or anti-inflammatory factors on activin A release by HUVEC. Methods: Activin A and follistatin concentrations were measured in the HUVEC culture media using specific enzyme immunoassays. Activin A and follistatin mRNA were detect by RT-PCR in cultured HUVECs, whereas immunohistochemistrtry (IHC) and in situ hibridization (ISH) allowed the localization of both peptides and mRNA in the umbilical cord, respectively. Results: Dimeric activin A was detected in the HUVEC culture medium, whereas follistatin was below the assay detection limit. Activin A and follistatin, protein and mRNA, were immunolocalized by IHC and ISH, in the umbilical vein endothelia of fetuses from either uncomplicated or pre-eclamptic gestation. Both activin A and follistatin mRNAs were identified by RT-PCR in cultured HUVECs and a decrease of activin A expression among those fetuses with a brain sparing pattern of blood flow was observed (p<0.05). Urocortin significantly decreased activin A release by HUVEC (p<0,01) and no effect on activin A secretion was observed with IL-8, LPS, endothelin-1 or dexamethasone. Conclusions: Activin A and follistatin are present in the human umbilical vein endothelium in situ and both genes are transcribed by isolated HUVECs, but only activin A appears to be released at sufficient amounts as to be a contributory source of this hormone in fetal circulation. Activin A is also modulated in vitro by urocortin, a vasodilator peptide with predominantly anti-inflammatory action. The lower expression of activin A in the umbilical vein endothelium of fetuses with a brain spar

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Expression of urocortin by human umbilical vein endothelial cells: cytokines, endothelin and dexamethasone stimulates urocortin secretion
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
ntroduction: Urocortin (Ucn) is a 40-amino-acid peptide member of the corticotropin-releasing factor (CRF) family and is expressed by central nervous system and in various peripheral tissues. Ucn also has a marked vasodilatory activity on the fetal-placental circulation, on cord blood and on maternal plasma. Ucn levels are increased in hypertensive disorders of pregnancy, suggesting a possible effect on placental vasculature.
Objectives: Evaluate whatever human umbilical vein endothelial cell (HUVEC) express Ucn mRNA and how Ucn secretion is modulated in cultured HUVEC by inflammatory cytokines, vasoactive peptides or steroid hormones.
Materials and Methods: Human umbilical cords were obtained from healthy women who underwent uncomplicated term pregnancies (n=5). Once grown to confluence, HUVEC were incubated according to the different experimental conditions and culture media were collected until urocortin assay. Urocortin mRNA expression was assessed by RT-PCR on culture cells.
Results: Ucn mRNA was detected in HUVEC cultures. Ucn concentrations were detectable at low levels in culture medium from untreated confluent endothelial cells at different incubation time points. Incubation with IFN-gama increased significantly Ucn secretion in a dose-dependent manner (p < .0001). Treatment with IL-8 (1,0; 10 and 100 ng/ml), dexamethasone (10-7 and 10-6 mol/L) or endothelin-1 (10-6 mol/L) was able to stimulate Ucn release from cultured endothelial cells (p < .0001). Treatment with PGF2α, progesterone or 17 -estradiol did not change Ucn release from HUVEC.
Discussion: The expression and secretion of Ucn from endothelial cells suggests a local function on fetal-placental circulation and multiple regulatory factors modulate Ucn secretion from culture HUVEC.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dipartimento di Pediatria, Ostetricia e Medicina della Riproduzione

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CRH receptors and Progesterone resistance during in vitro decidualization in endometriosis
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Context: The expression and function of several endometrial factors are altered in endometriosis. Objective: evaluate the in vitro decidualization process in healthy and endometriosis patients and the role of CRH receptors. Design/Setting: In vitro study conducted at the University of Siena, Policlinico Le Scotte . Patients: Proliferative endometrium were obtained from healthy fertile women (n=8) or from women with endometriosis (n=8). Interventions: After confluence, endometrial stromal cells were treated with estradiol plus medroxiprogesterone acetate alone or with CRH-R1 (antalarmin) or -R2 (astressin2b) antagonists. Outcome Measures: Prolactin secretion was assessed by ELISA. Prolactin and CRH-R1 expression were assessed by RT-PCR. Results: Cultured stromal cells from patients with endometriosis have impaired decidualization when compared to controls at day 6 (P<0.05) and at day 8 (P<0.01). Antalarmin reduced prolactin secretion in cells from healthy patients from day 6 of decidualization (P<0.05). At day 8, prolactin levels were diminished in both treated groups (P<0.01) when compared to controls. In the endometriosis group, antalarmin reduced prolactin secretion at day 8 when compared to controls (P<0.01), while astressin2b had no effect. Increased prolactin levels in stromal cells supernatants from healthy (P<0.001) and endometriosis patients (P<0.01) were observed from day zero to day 6 in cells treated with steroid hormones alone or with CRH-R antagonists. CRH-R1 mRNA increased significantly during decidualization in stromal cells from controls when compared to endometriosis. Conclusions: Decidualization is impaired in endometriosis and a crucial role of CRH-R1 in the regulation of endometrial differentiation in healthy and endometriosis patients can be hypothesized.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Attenuated tubal and endometrial urocortin 1 and corticotrophin releasing hormone receptor expression in ectopic pregnancy
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The etiology of tubal ectopic pregnancy (EP) remains uncertain. This study examined Fallopian tube (FT) and endometrial urocortin 1 (Ucn1) and CRH receptor (CRH-R1 and CRH-R2) expression in EP and intrauterine pregnancy (IUP) using quantitative-RT-PCR and immunohistochemistry. Tubal Ucn1 mRNA expression was higher in luteal compared to follicular phase (P<0.01) and equivalent to follicular phase in FT from EP. Tubal CRH-R1 and CRH-R2 expression was lower in luteal phase (P<0.05) and in FT from EP compared to follicular phase (P<0.01). Ucn1 mRNA expression was lower in endometrium from EP compared to IUP (viable and non-viable) (P<0.05). CRH-R1 mRNA expression was higher in endometrium from EP compared to viable IUP (P<0.05). No differences were observed in CRH-R2 expression. CRH-R1 protein was primarily localised to epithelium of FT and endometrium. The demonstration of attenuated tubal/endometrial Ucn1 and CRH-R expression in EP supports an important role of the CRH family in embryo implantation.
